description: A nylon bandolier for keeping rifle cartridges at hand.  Wraps around your torso, with the cartridge belt at the front.
//longest_side: assumes the textile item is folded thrice when stored

//ammo_restriction: removed .22 LR capacity: the casing appears to be too thin to fit snug into the slots

description: A nylon bandolier strapped around the torso for keeping 12 40mm grenades at hand.  Its design is quite reminiscent of something you've seen in an action film.
//weight: based on a model with similar functionality

notes: length is the average of two extremes to which the belt expands/contracts
width assumed due to being a belt

//longest_side: assumes the textile item is folded thrice when stored
//flags: removed OVERSIZE: while this belt is accomodating, it's unlikely to be comfortable for someone significantly larger than even a large regular human

description: A stretchy nylon belt with loops for 25 12-gauge shotgun shells, or ammunition of similar caliber.  Adjustable length makes it comfortable to wear for most sizes.

notes: length is the average of two extremes to which the belt expands/contracts

//longest_side: assumes the textile item is folded thrice when stored

//ammo_restriction: removed .410 capacity: appears to be too small to be held effectively by the loops
added .700 NX capacity: the round appears to be similar-enough in diameter to 12 gauge (0.729 in.)

//flags: removed OVERSIZE: while this belt is accomodating, it's unlikely to be comfortable for someone significantly larger than even a large regular human

description: A nylon bandolier strapped around the torso.  Holds up to 55 12-gauge shells, or ammunition of similar caliber.

notes: length is calculated from diameter of a 12-gauge shell (0.729 in.) for 55 + 3 shells (to account for the overall length of the bandolier)

//longest_side: assumes the textile item is folded thrice when stored

//ammo_restriction: removed .410 capacity: appears to be too small to be held effectively by the loops
added .700 NX capacity: the round appears to be similar-enough in diameter to 12 gauge (0.729 in.)

//flags: removed OVERSIZE: while this belt is accomodating, it's unlikely to be comfortable for someone significantly larger than even a large regular human

//notes: this bandolier is generally offered for as many cartridge loops as would fit the 60-inch strap
for the sake of balance, and since the manufacturer offers non-standard loop count as a custom request, we assume that only the front of the bandolier would be outfitted with loops
this would allow us to not model back loops, which would be significantly more difficult to get to
we model this item as if it's designed for .45 ACP but also allowed to take reasonable alternatives
description: An embroidered leather bandolier for keeping pistol cartridges at hand.  If this doesn't make you feel like a cowboy, nothing will.
//weight: estimated as area of bandolier × leather thickness per sq.ft.
(bandolier length [60 in.] × bandolier width [1.275 in.]) × leather thickness [8 oz / sq.ft.] = 4.25 oz = 120.49 g ≈ 121 g
width of bandolier estimated visually based on length of .45 ACP cartridge when stored in a loop of the bandolier

notes: height is cow hide thickness (8 oz ≈ 3.2 mm) multiplied by 2
width is based on length of .45 ACP cartridge and adjusted from visual reference
length is presumed to be for bandolier as worn, not overall (60 in. × 2)

//longest_side: because this item is made of thick leather, we assume it would only fold twice

//ammo_restriction: removed the following calibers from capacity: the casings appears to be too thin or much too thick to fit snug into the slots

//flags: removed OVERSIZE: while this belt is somewhat-accomodating, it's unlikely to be comfortable for someone significantly larger than even a large regular human

//notes: the basis for this override was taken from a post-0.G change in the base game
we model pocket dimensions to account for the item's intended use: 3× 5.56mm loaded stripper clips per pocket
there is a possibility of extending the bandolier down to allow for holding a 30-round magazine per pocket
as stated in source and confirmed by the following blog post
for now, we pretend this possibility does not exist
sounds like the change would be permanent, thus warranting a `transform` property
the paper inserts are currently modelled as being part of the bandolier, rather than removable
name: Army 5.56mm repack kit 4-pocket bandolier
description: A faded green-ish fabric satchel with four pockets, that can be worn on a strap.  Each pocket, fitted with a paper box, can hold up to three loaded 10-round 5.56mm NATO stripper clips, for a total of 120 rounds.  These used to be issued to the US troops during the Vietnam War.  Now, this is purely a surplus item; while mostly obsoleted by modern modular gear, the ability to quickly reload several magazines in the field can prove invaluable.
//weight: given the following dimensions of the bag
and average cotton density of (0.3 + 0.6) / 2 = 0.45 g/cm3, we get 6.6 × 0.45 = 2.97 g for the bag itself
when taking following interior dimensions of the paper insert
and subtracting them from the insert's exterior dimensions (accounting for estimated wall thickness of 0.1 mm on each side)
we get 167.41 - 165.34 = 2.07 ml for the insert's own volume
with average density of paper assumed to be (0.7 + 1.2) / 2 = 0.95 g/cm3, we get 2.07 × 0.95 = 1.9665 g for each insert, and 1.9665 × 4 = 7.866 g for all 4 of them

notes: length is (overall length of a 5.56mm NATO round [2.26 in.] × 4) + 20% (to account for extra fabric)
width is length of a 5.56mm stripper clip (~100 mm) + 20% (to account for extra fabric)
height (depth) is (5.56mm round's rim diameter (0.378 in.) × 3) + 1.25% (to account for paper insert and extra fabric), rounded
height is set high to account for `rigid` pockets

//longest_side: it appears as though a full bandolier could only be folded twice
//flags: removed OVERSIZE: while this bandolier is somewhat-accomodating, it's unlikely to be comfortable for someone significantly larger than even a large regular human

description: A novelty leather wrist band, with 10 small straps for holding spare rounds.  The straps have enough stretch in them to comfortably hold pistol and rifle cartridges.
//pocket_data: removed anything larger in diameter than .45-70
added missing calibers that would make sense
//flags: removed PALS_SMALL: this is a novelty, possibly handcrafted item that's always been meant to be worn around the wrist
